Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a rosette. The steeply-sloping shoulder is decorated with three short transverse grooves on each side and two similar grooves at each side of the nozzle. The nozzle-top is decorated with herring-bone pattern. At the rear is an unpierced handle with two grooves on each side of the spine. The lamps stands on a pseudo-base-ring.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: J A R Munro
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Marion-Arsinoe, Western Necropolis tomb K50
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2069)
Munro & Tubbs 1890 / Excavations in Cyprus, 1889. Second season's work. Polis tes Chrysochou-Limniti (p. 34)
